DataElement.preferredName: Deep Incision Surgical Site Infection Characteristic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The characteristics that identify a deep incisional surgical site infection that occurs within 30 days after a surgery that involves deep soft tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Deep Incision Surgical Site Infection Characteristic
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues._An infection that occurs at a surgical site within 30 days after an operation._Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.

Concepts.definition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues.
An infection that occurs at a surgical site within 30 days after an operation.

PermissibleValues.value: Diagnosis of a deep incision SSI by a surgeon or attending physician
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Deep Incision Surgical Site Infection Surgeon Diagnosis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Deep Incision Surgical Site Infection Surgeon Diagnosis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues.: An infection that occurs at a surgical site within 30 days after an operation.: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues.
An infection that occurs at a surgical site within 30 days after an operation.
A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

PermissibleValues.value: Purulent drainage from the deep incision but not from the organ/space component of the surgical site

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues.: Consisting of or containing pus; associated with the formation of or caused by pus.

Concepts.definition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues.
Pus-containing fluid that is draining from an orifice or wound.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues.: Splitting of the sutured margins of a surgical wound. Risk factors include diabetes mellitus, obesity, and advanced age.

Concepts.definition: An incision that involves deep soft tissues.
Splitting of the sutured margins of a surgical wound. Risk factors include diabetes mellitus, obesity, and advanced age.

PermissibleValues.value: Wound is deliberately opened by a surgeon

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.
Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fever, also known as pyrexia, is the elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal, usually taken as 37.7 degrees C.  Most fevers are caused by infections and almost all infectious diseases cause fever. (Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Restricted to the site of origin, without evidence of spread.: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Discomfort elicited through touch or pressure.

Concepts.definition: Restricted to the site of origin, without evidence of spread.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Discomfort elicited through touch or pressure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having a moderate degree of heat.

Concepts.definition: Having a moderate degree of heat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.: General term referring to the maintenance of cell strains or lines in the laboratory.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
General term referring to the maintenance of cell strains or lines in the laboratory.

PermissibleValues.value: An abscess or other evidence of infection involving the deep incision is found on direct examination, during reoperation, or by histopathologic or radiologic examination
